bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to I.T. Haig, September 21, 1940

div1.p: Hench informs Haig that he will write to Bevan regarding the framboyant tree.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to I.T. Haig, September 21, 1940
div1.opener:
September 21, 1940
Mr. I. T. Haig, Chief
Division of Forest Management Research
United States Department of Agriculture
Washington, D. C.
R
INFORMATION
Inquiries
My dear Mr. Haig:
div1.p:
I do appreciate greatly your reply to my inquiry
of August 28, and if you suggest, I would be delighted to
write Mr. Bevan, Director of the Tropical Forest Experiment
Station in Puerto Rico, and send him the two photographs
of the framboyant tree, the approximate age of which I am
so anxious to know.

Would you please let me know Mr. Bevan's full name
and whether I am correct in his address?
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
